Component Volume

H2O

source.body: This protocol uses 2/5 reagents per sample compared to the original ARTIC protocol.
A mastermix should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and aliquoted into PCR strip tubes. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.body: A mastermix should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and added to the denatured RNA in the extraction and sample addition cabinet. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description: Gently mix by pipetting and pulse spin the tube to collect liquid at the bottom of the tube.

Incubate the reaction as follows:

Dilute cDNA by adding
H2O to each reaction.
If required resuspend lyophilised primers at a concentration of 100µM each

source.body: nCov-2019/V1 primers for this protocol were designed using Primal Scheme and generate overlapping 400nt amplicons.

We have proposed a modified primer set which gives better coverage than the original (V1) primer set. https://github.com/ItokawaK/Alt_nCov2019_primers
See detail described in the preprint.

source.description:
Generate primer pool stocks by adding
of each primer pair to a
Eppendorf labelled either “Pool 1 (100µM)” or “Pool 2 (100µM)”. Total volume should be
for Pool 1 (100µM) and
for Pool 2 (100µM). These are your 100µM stocks of each primer pool.

source.body: Primers should be diluted and pooled in the mastermix cabinet which should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Dilute this primer pool 1:10 in molecular grade water, to generate 10µM primer stocks. It is recommend that multiple aliquots of each primer pool are made to in case of degradation or contamination.

source.body: Primers need to be used at a final concentration of 0.015µM per primer. In this case both pools have 98 primers in so the requirement is 3.6µL primer pools (10uM) per 25µL reaction. For other schemes, adjust the volume added appropriately.

source.description:
In the mastermix hood set up the multiplex PCR reactions as follows in 0.2mL 8-strip PCR tubes or 96-well PCR plate:
Component Pool 1 Pool 2
5X Q5 Reaction Buffer
10 mM dNTPs
Q5 Hot Start DNA Polymerase
Primer Pool 1 or 2 (10µM)
Nuclease-free water
Total

source.body: A PCR mastermix for each pool should be made up in the mastermix cabinet and aliquoted into PCR strip tubes. Tubes should be wiped down when entering and leaving the mastermix cabinet.

source.description:
In the extraction and sample addition cabinet add
diluted cDNA to each tube and mix well by pipetting.

source.body: The extraction and sample addition cabinet should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Pulse centrifuge the tubes to collect the contents at the bottom of the tube.

Set-up the following program on the thermal cycler:
Stage Temperature Time
Heat Activation
30 cycles of ...
Denaturation
Annealing
Hold
Indefinite

source.body: ! Use 30 PCR cycles regardless of Ct values.

source.description: Combine the entire contents of “Pool 1” and “Pool 2” PCR reactions for each biological sample into to a new 8-strip PCR tubes or 96-well PCR plate.

Clean-up the amplicons using the AmpureXP using 1x volume.
Elute in
of low-TE buffer (10 mM tris-HCl pH8.0, 0.1 mM EDTA).
Transfer eluted DNA to a new 8-strip PCR tubes or 96-well PCR plate.

source.body: Amplicon clean-up should be performed in the post-PCR cabinet which should should be cleaned with decontamination wipes and UV sterilised before and after use.

source.description: Quantify the amplicon pools using the Quantus Fluorometer using Qubit dsDNA HS kit (Invitrogen).

!!! This step can be skipped if you prefer adjusting library concentrations after adapter ligation. We actually recommend normalizing library concentrations after adapter ligation since this is more immune to sample swapping. !!!
Normalize the input by diluting each sample to
by low-TE buffer.
If concentration is less than
, dilution is not necessary *.

source.body: * In our experience, samples with DNA concentration less than at this point do not generate meaningful results.
You can expect the quantity of DNA input will be directly proportional to the amount of data you will obtain if no further adjustment takes place.

source.body: This protocol uses 1/4 reagents per sample compared to the original QIAseq FX DNA library kit.
Make sure the plate is always during this procedure to avoid fragmentation.

source.description:
Remove the tube or plate from the thermal cycler after finishing the thermal program.
Take the adapter plate out of the kit box and thaw the content.
Add

source.body: Keep both end-prepped DNA mixture and thawed adapter solution during this step.

source.description:
Prepare a 1.5 or 2.0 ml low-binding tube.
Take
* ligated mixture from each well and pool them into the 1.5 or 2.0 ml low-binding tube.
Finaly, elute DNA in
low-TE or Elution Buffer.
Transfer the eluted DNA to a new 1.5 or 2.0 ml low-binding tube.
Purify again by Ampure XP using x1.2 volume.
Finaly, elute DNA in
low-TE or Elution Buffer.
Transfer the eluted DNA to a new 1.5 or 2.0 ml low-binding tube.

source.body:
*You can take different volumes by sample to adjust the DNA quantities of each library for optimal ratio.
See the Guidelines & Warnings section.

Now, the library is ready for sequencing after quantification.
You may use any routine methods working well for library quantification.
We recommend qPCR based methods in terms of accuracy and sensitivity.
If you do not have a good quantification technique, here is a relationship between DNA mass concentration measured by Qubit dsDNA HS kit (Invitrogen) versus molar concentration measured by qPCR for nine libraries recently we have obtained.

description:
This protocol is folked from "ARTIC amplicon sequencing protocol for MinION for nCoV-2019" by Josh Quick to adapt it to illumina sequencers.
Because the PCR products are fragmented and ligated with adapters, this protocol is not restricted to 250 PE mode of MiSeq.
While the library preparation uses QiaSeq FX by Qiagen and is basically straight forward (as par kit instruction but set to 1/4 scale), some tweaks for much of simplicity and speed were added.
